FOUND IN: Gules (heraldry): a general term for any red color within the spectrum used to denote nobility, generosity, or martial prowess.
Henrik Ibsen: Known as the father of modern drama, Ibsen revolutionized European theatre in the late 19th century with his realistic plays that addressed societal issues and psychological conflicts
Regalia: The ornamental furniture or decorative items used by a monarch during official ceremonies.
Icing: A sweet, often flavored glaze made from sugar with added ingredients like water or milk.
Breakfast - the first meal of the day
